greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes between n(n+1)/2 (exclusive) and (n+1)(n+2)/2 (inclusive).
comment: Inspired by the weaker Legendre conjecture that there should be at least one prime between n^2 and (n+1)^2.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(10) = 2 because between 10*(10+1)/2=55 and (10+1)*(10+2)/2=66 there are 2 primes: 59, 61.
xref: Essentially the same as A066888 and A090970.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 05 2001
ext: Definition improved by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 22 2003
